title: Validate canonical examples for RPLSampleV1, WELDocV1, block models, and SimpleExplV1.
For strong evidence, result closer to web-only probability.
For equal prior and web, result equals that probability.
Use synthetic logits arrays to test:
Mock provider API responses using responses or httpx_mock.
Valid JSON in the expected shape.
JSON wrapped in markdown or with extra text.
Ensure invalid values (e.g., prob_true > 1, invalid labels, missing fields) cause validation failures.
Run a sample config and assert:
Output JSON matches expected top-level keys.
Provider and model fields are present.
Only run when API keys are present.
Evaluate a known true claim (e.g. “The Earth orbits the Sun.”).
Run run_evals.py in a mode that uses mock provider.
The script produces a JSON file.
The file contains expected fields (brier, ece, etc.).
Verify warning flags (json_repaired_simple, validation_coerced) are set appropriately.
Tests for the combined probability function:
Add Pydantic models for RPL samples, WEL docs, blocks, explanation.
Ensure RPL/WEL still produce the same metrics for GPT‑5 as before.
Render multiple result cards using the same design.
Implement unit, provider, integration, and eval tests.
Wire them into existing pipeline where possible.
Add prompt templates and builder functions.
Integrate Grok from existing branch into its own adapters.
Swap direct GPT‑5 calls for adapter calls.
Support multiple AI models (GPT‑5, Grok, Gemini, DeepSeek) for the same claim.
notes: CLI + config now accept multi-model lists/overrides; docs and tests cover sequential model runs.

comments.author: Worker-1
comments.text: Claimed by Worker-1. Implemented provider router to support multi-model selection in RPL (live: gpt-5; mock: any). Next: add adapters for Grok, Gemini, DeepSeek as needed.

title: Abstract away provider-specific quirks into **adapters**, so the core RPL/WEL pipeline remains unchanged.
notes: Locking by Worker-4; starting provider adapter abstraction work per Phase‑1 harness constraints (no estimator changes).

comments.author: Worker-2
comments.text: Initial step: added provider registry (heretix/provider/registry.py) exposing get_live_scorer/get_score_fn and wired rpl to use it. Added unit test heretix/tests/test_provider_registry.py. No behavior changes; openai_gpt5 remains default for 'gpt-5'.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Locked by Worker-4. Verified provider adapter indirection is already implemented via provider/registry.py and used in rpl.py. Ran full test suite (62 passed) and a mock RPL run to confirm no regressions. No changes to estimator/CLI.

comments.author: Worker-2
comments.text: Progress: Implemented provider registry (heretix/provider/registry.py) + tests; rpl.py already uses get_live_scorer. Suite: 62 passed locally (HERETIX_RPL_SEED=42, uv run pytest -q). Leaving status in_progress; happy to handoff if Worker-4 owns it.

title: Ensure that adding or updating a model touches as few files as possible:
notes: Locking by Worker-6; starting analysis to minimize file churn when adding/updating models. Will align with Phase‑1 harness (no estimator or CLI contract changes).]

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Initial refactor landed: added provider adapter factory and switched RPL call-site to use it. Files: heretix/provider/factory.py, heretix/provider/base.py, heretix/rpl.py. All tests pass locally (62 passed). This reduces future file touches when adding/updating models by isolating selection logic. Next: document adapter interface and map additional model aliases in registry if needed.

title: Provide a **robust test and evaluation suite** that:
Is easy for automated agents to run after changes.
Web-informed verdict.
acceptance_criteria:
- heretix run supports --mode web_informed (mock + live)
- Output JSON has 'combined' block with p and ci95
- Writes artifact manifest when WEL enabled
- Default provider 'tavily' override via WEL_PROVIDER
- Smoke run: uv run heretix run --config runs/rpl_example.yaml --mock --mode web_informed --out runs/smoke_web.json
notes: Fixed provider registry import mismatch uncovered during web_informed run. All WEL tests green. Next: confirm live path end-to-end with OPENAI_API_KEY and Tavily key (if required).

comments.author: RedPond
comments.text: Locked task; fixed provider registry import mismatch in heretix/rpl.py (get_live_scorer -> get_score_fn) so CLI runs web_informed mode. Verified WEL tests pass and mock run writes runs/smoke_web.json. Next: confirm live run path and combined verdict output matches spec.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Starting work as Worker-8. Verified Web-Informed verdict path end-to-end: pipeline produces combined p/CI and sanitized web block; UI renders verdict strings. Full test suite passes (62 tests). Next: propose adding an explicit 'verdict' string to CLI JSON for easier consumers (optional).

title: Combined verdict (with explicit weighting).
notes: Adds a visible weighting block on the result card so prior/web contributions and the w_web blend are spelled out without opening the deeper panel.

title: Clear, concise explanation text in a stable layout.
All pipelines look up adapters through this registry.
API returns a consistent `RunResponse` for all providers.
Same card style, multiple models side-by-side.
Unit tests (schemas, JSON utils, combination logic).
Evals (calibration / correctness) with small claim cohorts.
Mapping from **logical model IDs** to **concrete API model names**.
Handles messy model outputs once, centrally.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Assigned to RedCreek; no acceptance criteria or description. Checked Agent Mail inbox — no messages. Proceeding to standby; happy to pick up another ready task if clarified.

title: Resolve provider & logical model from config / runtime settings:
Combine PriorBlockV1 and WebBlockV1 numerically into CombinedBlockV1 using existing logit-based weighting logic.
Use ExplanationAdapter (or narrator adapter) to produce SimpleExplV1:
WEL adapters (wel_gpt5.py, wel_grok.py, etc.) follow a similar pattern:
For consistency, we can initially use a single narrator model (e.g. GPT‑5) for SimpleExplV1 across all providers.
Later, we may experiment with provider-specific explanations if desired.
Describes the RPL task in provider-agnostic terms:
Output a probability in [0,1] and categorical label.
Return JSON only, matching RPLSampleV1 schema.
Add instructions tailored to the provider:
“You are in JSON Schema mode; do not emit any non-JSON text.” (OpenAI).
“Return a single JSON object. Do not preface with explanations.” (Grok/Gemini/DeepSeek).

comments.author: Worker-5
comments.text: Started: locked and assigned to Worker-5. Ran heretix/tests/test_openai_provider.py (mock) — pass. Provider adapter (OpenAI GPT-5 Responses) looks healthy; logs provider_model_id + prompt_sha256 per run. Clarify scope: do you want provider capability YAML (per-provider limits/tokens) or doc updates for env vars/concurrency? I can draft providers.yaml + docs next.

comments.author: Worker-5
comments.text: Progress: Added optional provider-config support and docs. Files: heretix/provider/config.py, configs/providers.example.yaml, documentation/provider-config.md. Wired OpenAI adapter to use YAML→env→default precedence for rate limits. All tests pass (62). Propose closing this as done; can iterate on schema if needed.

Phase‑1 Validation Sweep
description: Execute smoke and focused validation for the Phase‑1 RPL harness per AGENTS.md: mock run, CLI describe, DB persistence, seed determinism, and docs parity.
notes: Worker-6: Epic completed; all validation checks passed.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Worker-1: Completed mock RPL smoke (runs/smoke.json), verified describe output, and ran test suite (61 passed). DB artifacts present (runs/heretix.sqlite, runs/heretix_mock.sqlite).

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Worker-4: Completed Phase‑1 validation: tests pass (61/61), mock CLI run wrote runs/smoke.json with prob_true_rpl and ci95, and describe shows effective config/plan. DB artifacts present at runs/heretix_mock.sqlite and runs/heretix.sqlite. No bd blockers found; syncing JSONL.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Worker-6: Completed mock RPL smoke run via 'uv run heretix run --config runs/rpl_example.yaml --mock --out runs/smoke.json'. Aggregates: prob_true_rpl=0.2538, ci95=[0.2416, 0.2649]. DB persisted to runs/heretix_mock.sqlite. CLI describe and estimator invariants verified. Proceeding to seed determinism check and docs parity.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Worker-6: Seed determinism verified (same aggregates across HERETIX_RPL_SEED=42 and 7 in mock mode due to cached deterministic samples). DB persistence confirmed at runs/heretix_mock.sqlite. Docs parity: CLI flags and outputs match AGENTS.md scope for Phase‑1. Closing epic.

title: Smoke: Mock RPL run with runs/rpl_example.yaml
description: Run: uv run heretix run --config runs/rpl_example.yaml --mock --out runs/smoke.json. Verify JSON contains prob_true_rpl/ci95, and DB at runs/heretix.sqlite or mock DB presence, per AGENTS.md expectations.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Starting mock RPL run via uv

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Mock RPL run completed. Summary: prob_true_rpl=0.2538, ci95=[0.2416,0.2649], ci_width=0.0233, stability_score=0.665 (medium), compliance=1.0, cache_hit=1.0. Wrote runs/smoke.json and created SQLite at runs/heretix.sqlite (table: checks).

title: CLI: heretix describe outputs effective config and plan
description: Run: uv run heretix describe --config runs/rpl_example.yaml. Verify prompt_version, K/R/T, and computed plan are printed without network.

comments.author: michael
comments.text: Describe OK. Effective config shows prompt_version=rpl_g5_v5, K=16, R=2, T=16, seed=42. Plan balanced (imbalance_ratio=1.0), prompt_char_len_max=1358 under cap.

comments.author: michael
comments.text:
Worker-7: Verified CLI describe and mock run.
- heretix describe --config runs/rpl_example.yaml outputs correct config and balanced plan (T=16, planned_imbalance_ratio=1.0, bootstrap_seed_effective=42).
- Mock run: HERETIX_RPL_SEED=42 uv run heretix run --config runs/rpl_example.yaml --mock --out runs/smoke.json
  - combined_p≈0.254, CI95≈[0.242, 0.265], stability≈0.665, compliance=1.0, cache_hit=1.0.
  - Wrote artifact: runs/smoke.json (prompt_version=rpl_g5_v5_2025-09-15).
- Tests: uv run pytest -q → 61 passed.
- Beads: daemon healthy; doctor warns about missing pre-push hook (left unchanged).

title: Store provider, logical model, model IDs, tokens, cost, schema version.

Replace single result card with a responsive grid:
Desktop: 2 columns (or 3/4 depending on number of models).
Each option maps to (provider, logical_model, label), e.g:
“Training-only (model prior)” – shows prior metrics and summary.
“Web evidence (recent)” – shows web metrics and highlights.
“How we combine” – explanation derived from combined and SimpleExplV1.
Context mode selection remains: “Internal knowledge only” → mode="baseline", “Internet search” → mode="web_informed".

Single-model result card style (extended to multi-model grid).
